CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 20, 1946, pg. 1, reads: "...[ill.] Lucky Veterans and their families moved into the new [...] at McKinley Park Monday afternoon, after a colorful celebration attended by Mayor David L. Lawrence, Housing Administrator [...] Klein, and a number of other city officials. These homes were the first of the 750 veterans' temporary housing unites being constructed throughout the city to be readied for occupancy.  The photos, left to right, show Everett Utterback, executive assistant of the Housing Authority, and Mrs. Bishop Nelson Jr., examining the modern icebox which is provided for each apartment... - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Everett Utterback showing "Coolerator" refrigerator to Mrs. Bishop Nelson Jr., in kitchen of veteran's housing unit at McKinley Park
